it is every weekday morning from 9:00 am to 10:00 am and then I think they
follow with another show, it is on reg discovery channel, and they suggest
things you should think about when watching it things like that, usually
they run a whole week on one subject
you can check it out more at www.discoveryschool.com

messages.subject: Re: Re: Summer of deschooling and stil
messages.messageBody:
Diane wrote:
<< Discovery School is great, isn't it? A new season starts on Monday,
September 13. >>

I don't know what this is. Is this just on the regular Discovery Channel
everyday? Or is it a special Discovery channel you have to pay extra for? We
have a satellite DISH because we live too rural for cable.
Sounds like something my kids would go for in a big way.
Thanks in advance.
Carol from WI

messages.subject: Re: Re: Summer of deschooling and stil
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s on the regular Discovery Channel from 8-9 a.m. central, 9-10 EST.  Check out their website for all the info http://www.discoveryschool.com Diane from
messages.messageBody:
> From: Burkfamily@...
> I don't know what this is. Is this just on the regular Discovery Channel
> everyday? Or is it a special Discovery channel you have to pay extra for? We
> have a satellite DISH because we live too rural for cable.
> Sounds like something my kids would go for in a big way.

It's on the regular Discovery Channel from 8-9 a.m. central, 9-10
EST. Check out their website for all the info

http://www.discoveryschool.com



Diane from KS
jagwirtz@...

messages.subject: Re: Re: Summer of deschooling and stil
messages.msgSnippet: Carol, I think this notebook idea is wonderful,  and not just until you get the ideas flowing.  So often,  we think of something wonderful to do, but if we
messages.messageBody:
Carol,

I think this notebook idea is wonderful, and not just until you get
the ideas flowing. So often, we think of something wonderful to do,
but if we can't do it right then, we forget about it. Then I feel
guilty later for dropping the ball. I think I'll try this. Thanks!


Diane from KS
jagwirtz@...

messages.subject: Re: Re: Summer of deschooling and stil
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m glad somebody else jumped in with the URL.  I m having modem problems today.  We had a really bad lightening storm and I m afraid it may be damaged.
messages.messageBody:
> sounds great diane. do you know the url so i can get more info. sounds like
> somthing we would tape too.
>
I'm glad somebody else jumped in with the URL. I'm having modem
problems today. We had a really bad lightening storm and I'm afraid
it may be damaged.

There are also programs on TLC called TLC Elementary School. These
are great for younger kids that can't sit through a longer program
and don't want the in depth info.

At the website, you can sign up for a newsletter that brings you
info weekly. I also get an educator's guide in the mail every spring
and fall - really nice!

Diane from KS
jagwirtz@...

messages.subject: Re: Re: Summer of deschooling and stil
messages.msgSnippet: ... Discovery School is great, isn t it?  A new season starts on Monday, September 13.  I think it starts with a five part program on Rome. We tape it though,
messages.messageBody:
>laxed about it since, we usually start our day with picking up then
> discovery school that runs and hour or two on the discovery channel, they
> usually like this because they get tokick back and relax while they watch
> it, I am still trying to relax more, I do say things like here is the
>
Discovery School is great, isn't it? A new season starts on Monday,
September 13. I think it starts with a five part program on Rome.
We tape it though, so we can watch it whenever we want. 8 a.m.
central time is a little early for us, although once in awhile we
catch a Little House rerun then. <vbg>

Diane from KS
jagwirtz@...
